title: A positive post on League <3
body:
It's not often I am in a game that lasts the distance where every player is full build, and 'being fed' becomes pretty irrelevant. Those games where there are open Nexus on both sides and absolutely every player is vital to the win, and 1 single death will affect the push.

Got to play one of those last night, 57min game final score 60 v 61 (a loss for us). This screen shot is one of many how close the game was for either side, Irelia back doored us while our attention was in front of base, 1 more AA would have finished this 10mins earlier. The nexus was on 68hp
http://puu.sh/qUnh4/b279a97516.png

There was zero toxicity throughout this entire game, the odd friendly banter here and there, but when things got heavy it was strictly business for both teams and chat was quiet. There was flashy outplays and fantastic jukes, multi-kills and of course mistakes from both teams. The overall vibe was a friendly environment, every player felt important but was encouraged through a mistake, not flamed or ridiculed.
Not a single person on our team was disheartened by the loss neither, because it was so close we knew someone had to slip eventually. Digital handshakes where exchanged all round at post game.

These are the kinds of games that make this game SO much fun to play, I literally find myself sitting on the edge of my seat with every decision either team makes. This is the kind of game that keeps me coming back, regardless of how good or bad I am playing. Even if it only happens every now and then.

For all the hate League can and does receive, you have to admit... This game is capable of producing some of the most fun gaming experiences you can possibly have!

replies.body: I love those 40+ minute games! Really glad you had an awesome experience.
that rare moment when the matchmaking system gets it right

i just had one of those games, it was fucking exhilarating , we a bunch of solos cameback and beat a 4 man premade.

after a shaky 25 minutes it was looking like an ff but we pressed on and 40 minutes later won the game.

i ended on 6/10/41 yorick support.

back to the shitfest now.

nice.

close games throughout are great, but the comeback ones (where your team was the underdog) are probably the best.
Too many FF @ 20 and give up so easily now, i've seen games won from completely improbable odds yet some are not patient enough to try turn things around
A very rare post indeed, you won't find another one of these for a while
